original_title: Variable-Nozzle Ducted Fan Provides Fluid Dynamics Lessons
original_content:
Any student new to the principles of fluid dynamics will be familiar with Bernoullis principle and the Venturi effect, where the speed of a liquid or gas increases when the size of the conduit it flows through decreases. When applying this principle to real-world applications, though, it can get a bit more complex than a student may learn about at first, mostly due to the shortcomings of tangible objects when compared to their textbook ideals. [Mech Ninja] discovered this while developing a ducted fan based around an RC motor.
The ducted fan is meant to be a stand-in for a model jet engine, based around a high-powered motor generally designed for drone racing. Most of the build is 3D printed including duct system, but in order to improve the efficiency and thrust beyond simple ducting, [Mech Ninja] designed and built a variable nozzle to more finely control the exhaust of his engine. This system is also 3D printed and can restrict or open up the outflow of the ducted fan, much like a real jet engine would. It uses two servos connected to collars on the outside of the engine. When the servos move the collars, a set of flaps linked to the collars can choke or expand the opening at the rear of the engine.
This is where some of the complexity of real-life designs comes into play, though. After testing the system with a load cell under a few different scenarios, the efficiency and thrust werent always better than the original design without the variable nozzle. [Mech Ninja] suspects that this is due to the gaps between the flaps, allowing air to escape and disrupting the efficient laminar flow of the air leaving the fan, and plans to build an improved version in the future. Fluid dynamics can be a fairly complex arena to design within, sometimes going in surprising directions like this ducted fan that turned out better than the theory would have predicted, at least until they accounted for all the variables in the design.
title: 「制御可能なノズルを備えた3Dプリントのダクテッドファン」
body:
[要約]
記事では、モーターを使用したダクテッドファンの開発について説明されている。可変ノズルを使用して出力を制御できるが、実際の性能は予想外に複雑で、改善の余地があると考えられている。将来的に改良を行う予定。
titles: 「制御可能なノズルを備えた3Dプリントのダクテッドファン」
「学生が学ぶ理論との違い：変わり種ダクテッドファンの実験結果」
「実際の設計と理論のギャップ：ダクテッドファン改善のための課題」
「ノズルフラップの隙間からの効率悪化を発見」
「RCモータをベースにしたダクテッドファンの開発試作」
